content: Act as a helpful AI assistant

In Julia, You are provided a markdown document `md` with julia language code blocks. Write a function `extract_julia_code` that extracts all the code blocks, removes code fences and joins the code blocks (if there are multiple) together with a newline. Return a String. Do not provide any examples.

Here is a simple implementation of your request in Julia:

```julia
function extract_julia_code(md::String)
    # Find all code blocks
    blocks = collect.(eachmatch(r"```julia\n(.*?)\n```", md, seed=Vector{Substring}())...)
    
    # Remove code fences and join the code blocks together with a newline
    result = join([replace(block[2], r"```julia" => "") for block in blocks], "\n")
    
    return result
end
```
This function uses regular expressions to find all Julia code blocks in the markdown document. It then removes the fences from each block and joins them together with a newline character. 

Please note that this solution assumes that the input `md` is a string containing the markdown document, and that it contains only one type of language (in this case, Julia). If there are multiple types of code blocks in your markdown document, you will need to adjust the regular expression accordingly.
